file_summary: This shell script serves as a POSIX-compliant startup script for Gradle. Its primary purpose is to locate the Gradle installation, determine the appropriate Java Runtime Environment (JRE), configure the necessary JVM options, and then execute the `gradle-wrapper.jar` file. The script robustly handles various operating systems, including Cygwin, MSYS, Darwin, and NonStop, by adjusting paths and commands accordingly. It resolves symbolic links to find the `APP_HOME` directory, checks for the presence of Java (either via `JAVA_HOME` or in the system PATH), and increases the maximum file descriptor limit for better performance. Furthermore, it aggregates JVM options from predefined `DEFAULT_JVM_OPTS`, environment variables like `JAVA_OPTS` and `GRADLE_OPTS`, and command-line arguments, carefully parsing them using `xargs` to avoid word-splitting issues. The script is designed to be highly compatible with POSIX shells, deliberately avoiding Bash/Ksh extensions like arrays, and is generated from a Groovy template within the Gradle project.

attributes.name: app_path
attributes.description: Used internally to resolve the script's path.

attributes.name: APP_HOME
attributes.description: The resolved home directory of the Gradle application.

attributes.name: APP_BASE_NAME
attributes.description: The base name of the startup script itself.

attributes.name: MAX_FD
attributes.description: Target maximum number of file descriptors to set, 'maximum' by default.

attributes.name: cygwin
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the script is running on a Cygwin environment.

attributes.name: msys
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the script is running on an MSYS/MinGW environment.

attributes.name: darwin
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the script is running on a Darwin (macOS) environment.

attributes.name: nonstop
attributes.description: Flag indicating if the script is running on a NonStop environment.

attributes.name: CLASSPATH
attributes.description: The Java classpath for launching the Gradle wrapper JAR.

attributes.name: JAVACMD
attributes.description: The full path to the Java executable chosen to run Gradle.

attributes.name: DEFAULT_JVM_OPTS
attributes.description: Default JVM options applied by the script (e.g., -Xmx, -Xms).

attributes.name: JAVA_HOME
attributes.description: Environment variable specifying the path to a Java installation.

attributes.name: JAVA_OPTS
attributes.description: Environment variable for additional JVM options.

attributes.name: GRADLE_OPTS
attributes.description: Environment variable for Gradle-specific JVM options.

functions.name: warn
functions.description: Prints a warning message to standard error (stderr).

functions.name: die
functions.description: Prints an error message to standard error (stderr) and then exits the script with a non-zero status.

dependent_class_list: cygpath (path conversion utility for Cygwin/MSYS, conditional)
xargs (build and execute command lines from standard input)
sed (stream editor for filtering and transforming text)
exec (replace the shell with a new command)
